intro: Phacelia brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phacelia brachyantha is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
